content.json:
# Central Threat Intelligence - Integration Hub

This workbook enables you to manage threat intelligence feeds, configure integrations, and monitor data flow across your security ecosystem. Use it to review source data, configure distribution settings, and troubleshoot integration issues.

> **Note:** This is one of three workbooks in the CTI solution. Also see the [CTI Dashboard](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Monitoring/AzureMonitoringBrowseBlade/workbooks/name/cti-dashboard) and [CTI Indicator Management](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Monitoring/AzureMonitoringBrowseBlade/workbooks/name/cti-indicator-management) workbooks.

parameters.label: Min Confidence
parameters.description: Only show indicators >= this confidence score

content.title: Process Indicator

content.query:
// Query for existing intelligence feeds
union 
    (CTI_IntelligenceFeeds_CL
    | where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
    | extend Type = FeedType_s, Name = FeedName_s, URL = FeedURL_s, LastUpdate = LastUpdateTime_t, Status = iff(Active_b, "Active", "Inactive")
    | project FeedId = FeedId_g, Type, Name, URL, Active = Active_b, Status, LastUpdate, Created = TimeGenerated)
| order by Type asc, LastUpdate desc
content.title: Configured Threat Intelligence Feeds

content.json:
# {DistributionTarget} Configuration

Use this section to configure how threat intelligence is distributed to {DistributionTarget}.

## Connector Status

The connector for {DistributionTarget} is currently operational. The connector automatically syncs indicators based on the configuration below.

content.query:
// Distribution configuration for the selected target
let target = "{DistributionTarget}";

// Count indicators distributed to the target
union 
(CTI_IPIndicators_CL
| where Active_b == true and DistributionTargets_s has target
| extend Type = "IP"),
(CTI_DomainIndicators_CL
| where Active_b == true and DistributionTargets_s has target
| extend Type = "Domain"),
(CTI_URLIndicators_CL
| where Active_b == true and DistributionTargets_s has target
| extend Type = "URL"),
(CTI_FileHashIndicators_CL
| where Active_b == true and DistributionTargets_s has target
| extend Type = "File Hash")
| summarize Count = count() by Type
| order by Count desc
content.title: Indicators Distributed to {DistributionTarget}

parameters.name: AutoApprove
parameters.label: Auto-Approve New Indicators
parameters.description: Automatically approve indicators for distribution without manual review

parameters.name: MinimumConfidence
parameters.label: Minimum Confidence Score
parameters.description: Only distribute indicators meeting this confidence threshold

parameters.name: AllowedTypes
parameters.label: Allowed Indicator Types
parameters.description: Which indicator types to distribute to this target

parameters.name: SyncFrequency
parameters.label: Sync Frequency
parameters.description: How often to sync indicators to this target

parameters.name: DefaultAction
parameters.label: Default Action
parameters.description: Default action when indicators are matched

content.json:
## Distribution Configuration

The settings in this form control how indicators are distributed to {DistributionTarget}.

### Configuration Notes

- **Auto-Approve**: When enabled, new indicators are automatically approved for distribution without manual review if they meet the confidence threshold
- **Minimum Confidence**: Only indicators with this confidence score or higher will be distributed
- **Allowed Types**: Select the indicator types that should be distributed to this target
- **Sync Frequency**: How often the system should check for new indicators to distribute
- **Default Action**: The default action when indicators are matched (can be overridden per indicator)

### Target-Specific Notes

**{DistributionTarget}** has the following limitations and features:

- Maximum indicators: **100,000**
- API Rate Limits: **60 requests per minute**
- Supported indicator types: {AllowedTypes}
- Primary use cases: Blocking malicious network connections, attachments, and URLs

> In a production environment, these settings would be saved to a configuration table and used by the Logic Apps to control distribution.

content.title: Configuration Save Status
System Component Health
content.noDataMessage: No system status information available yet. The system may still be deploying.

content.title: Recent Connector Runs
content.noDataMessage: No connector runs found in the selected time range.

content.query:
// System metrics - indicator processing rate
// Get indicator counts over time
union 
(CTI_IPIndicators_CL
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| extend Type = "IP"),
(CTI_DomainIndicators_CL
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| extend Type = "Domain"),
(CTI_URLIndicators_CL
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| extend Type = "URL"),
(CTI_FileHashIndicators_CL
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 1d)
| extend Type = "File Hash")
| order by TimeGenerated asc
content.title: Indicator Growth Rate
Distribution Target Status
System Diagnostics

content.json:
## Implementation Instructions

### Required Permissions

Users need to have appropriate permissions to use this workbook:

- `Microsoft Sentinel Contributor` role on the Log Analytics workspace
- Or create a custom role with appropriate permissions for management tasks

### Production Implementation

In a production environment, you'll need to:

1. **Update Data Submission Logic**: Replace the query visualizations with appropriate `_Data_PutBlob` and `_Data_Execute` calls
2. **Configure Logic Apps**: Ensure the Logic Apps are properly configured to use the tables and configuration settings
3. **Set up Feed Management**: Create a `CTI_IntelligenceFeeds_CL` table to store feed definitions
4. **Create Distribution Configuration Storage**: Implement storage for distribution settings

### Integration Points

This workbook is designed to interact with:

- **Logic Apps**: For automation of feed polling and indicator distribution
- **CTI Tables**: For storing indicators, feed definitions, and configuration
- **Microsoft Defender/Sentinel APIs**: For indicator distribution and synchronization
